intro: Oldenlandia ramosissima, commonly known as the hairy false Solomon's seal, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its branched, hairy stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in native plant gardens.
